I’m way too short for overpacked concerts, and overwhelming food halls with hungry tourists and long lines make me break out in a cold sweat. But there’s one place that’s got all the makings of these environments, but is so the opposite that, surprise of all surprises, I’d spend my whole day here if I could.Instagram contentThis content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.I’m talking about Bow Market in Somerville, Massachusetts, a new-ish strip mall–ish joint that’s the perfect amount of busy: buzzy, without being jam-packed. It helps that the setup is a two-story ring of 30+ small, separate establishments—each with its own real door!—surrounding a central courtyard where you can take your food to-go. Oh, and the food! There’s bimbimap from Perillas, natural wine from feminist bar Rebel Rebel,  crunchy bar pizza from Hot Box, fluffy pierogies from Jaju, or fancy chocolates made with fresh, local ingredients from Gâté Comme des Filles. There’s literally something for everyone—including even normal food hall haters like me.Go there: Bow MarketExplore Bon AppétitHighly RecommendBostonRestaurantsRecipes you want to make.
